*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Saucedo, August 28, 1826. Asking approval of a plan formulated by a local convention for maintaining a standing militia force on frontier.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Through my communication of the *date_mentioned n="08-14-1826">14th Instant*/date_mentioned*, I informed your *person_mentioned*Lordship */person_mentioned*that I had called a meeting of the *person_mentioned*people*/person_mentioned*, to agree upon some system of defence for this *location_mentioned*section*/location_mentioned*, until the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*can adopt measures for the protection of the whole *location_mentioned*frontier of Texas*/location_mentioned*. The *person_mentioned*board */person_mentioned*assembled on the *date_mentioned n="08-21-1826">21st Instant*/date_mentioned*, and, after due deliberation, we agreed upon the following articles, which are to receive the approbation of your *person_mentioned*Lordship */person_mentioned*before they are carried into effect.*/p*
*p*Articles agreed upon by the *person_mentioned*Board*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*First: All the *person_mentioned*militia */person_mentioned*of this *location_mentioned*Jurisdiction */location_mentioned*shall be organized into twelve *person_mentioned*sections*/person_mentioned*; one section to be sent to the *location_mentioned*frontier */location_mentioned*every month, to do duty as *person_mentioned*spies*/person_mentioned*, or *location_mentioned*frontier */location_mentioned**person_mentioned*guard*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Second: These *person_mentioned*sections */person_mentioned*shall include all the *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*living in this *location_mentioned*Jurisdiction*/location_mentioned*, whether resident in lawful possession of land, or not; provided they are able to bear arms. All those who own *location_mentioned*half a league of land*/location_mentioned* shall be included in said *person_mentioned*section*/person_mentioned*, even though he be exempted from service in the *person_mentioned*National Militia*/person_mentioned* Regulations, in consequence of his age, physical impediment, or for other reasons; all those who have *location_mentioned*two leagues of land*/location_mentioned* shall be counted as two *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*in the organization of said *person_mentioned*classes*/person_mentioned*; those who have *location_mentioned*four leagues*/location_mentioned* shall be counted as four *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*; and those who have more than *location_mentioned*eight leagues*/location_mentioned* shall be counted as five *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Third: Those who have *location_mentioned*half a league and upwards,*/location_mentioned* and are not actual *person_mentioned*residents */person_mentioned*of this *location_mentioned*Jurisdiction*/location_mentioned*, shall enter said *person_mentioned*classes */person_mentioned*and be counted at the call of one man for each half league, up to two leagues; above which quantity, they shall come within the provisions of the following article. In case said *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*should be absent and should fail to supply a man in their place, they shall be considered as responsible for the ordinary rate of the hire of a *person_mentioned*substitute*/person_mentioned*, which amount shall be collected by the civil *person_mentioned*authorities */person_mentioned*and be paid into the Treasury of this Department.*/p*
*p*Fourth: In case that any person should fail to serve at his time, or to supply a *person_mentioned*substitute */person_mentioned*agreeably to these regulations, then the *person_mentioned*Commanding Officer of the Militia*/person_mentioned* of the *location_mentioned*district */location_mentioned*to which that person may belong, shall hire a *person_mentioned*substitute */person_mentioned*to serve in his place, provided that such *person_mentioned*substitute */person_mentioned*shall not receive more than $40, a month, to be paid in merchandize, or the productions of the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*; and said *person_mentioned*Commanding Officer of the district*/person_mentioned* shall forthwith make his report to the *person_mentioned*Alcaldes of the *location_mentioned*Jurisdiction*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* in which the *person_mentioned*absentee*/person_mentioned* and the *person_mentioned*substitute */person_mentioned*hired in his place may reside; and the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*shall order the *person_mentioned*Sheriff */person_mentioned*to collect the amounts, due by said *person_mentioned*absentee*/person_mentioned*, from his property by a public sale of the same, the proceeds, when collected, to be paid to said *person_mentioned*substitute*/person_mentioned*. In case of the sickness of any of the *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*, the *person_mentioned*officers of the district*/person_mentioned*, jointly with the *person_mentioned*Alcalde*/person_mentioned*, may relieve him from one tour of duty, but no more. *person_mentioned*Volunteers*/person_mentioned*, shall, in all cases, be received to supply the place of *person_mentioned*absentees*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Fifth: The *person_mentioned*Commanding Officer of the Jurisdiction*/person_mentioned*, having a due regard to the respective strength of the various *person_mentioned*parties*/person_mentioned*, and in conformity to the inventory of *location_mentioned*lands */location_mentioned*belonging to each person, shall assess the number of the *person_mentioned*militia*/person_mentioned*, that each *location_mentioned*district */location_mentioned*shall supply every month, and he shall give corresponding orders to the respective *person_mentioned*commanding officers of the districts*/person_mentioned*; and these *person_mentioned*officers*/person_mentioned*, jointly with the *person_mentioned*Alcalde*/person_mentioned*, shall divide the *person_mentioned*men of their district*/person_mentioned*, who are thus bound to serve according to these regulations, into twelve *person_mentioned*sections*/person_mentioned*, one for each month, in a just and impartial manner.*/p*
*p*Sixth. Said *person_mentioned*Commanding Officer of the Jurisdiction*/person_mentioned*, shall, if possible, engage an *person_mentioned*officer */person_mentioned*to take the permanent command of the *person_mentioned*party*/person_mentioned* referred to in the first article of these regulations; and, if it be impracticable, from want of the necessary funds to pay the *person_mentioned*officer*/person_mentioned*, the said *person_mentioned*Commanding Officer*/person_mentioned* shall detail from among the *person_mentioned*officers of the Militia*/person_mentioned*, one for every month, selecting those whom he deems best qualified for that duty.*/p*
*p*The object of the plan is to keep twenty or thirty mounted *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned* continually on the *location_mentioned*frontier */location_mentioned*as *person_mentioned*spies*/person_mentioned*; as well for the preventing of the incursions of small parties of *person_mentioned*Indians*/person_mentioned*, as to give timely notice should they come in force to make a formal attack.*/p*
*p*The intention of the several articles is, to compel every one to contribute his share in the common defence in proportion to the interest he has in the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Some *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*who have received and own lands here, have gone to *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*in consequence of the *person_mentioned*Indian */person_mentioned*difficulties, thus hoping to avoid being compelled to furnish their proportion towards the defence of this *location_mentioned*Jurisdiction*/location_mentioned*, alleging that the laws governing the *person_mentioned*National Militia*/person_mentioned* only require their personal service in the *location_mentioned*district in which they reside*/location_mentioned*, and that while they live at *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*they are bound to do militia service there, and, that, therefore, they cannot be compelled to serve in this *location_mentioned*Jurisdiction*/location_mentioned*, although all of their property is here; adding, furthermore, the colonization law exempting the *person_mentioned*Colonists */person_mentioned*from taxes for some years, no taxes can be levied on the property they leave here, and that to compel them to serve in this manner amounts to a tax. Those who have *location_mentioned*more than two leagues of land*/location_mentioned* say also, that the law on *person_mentioned*Militia */person_mentioned*makes it obligatory on them to be in readiness to serve personally, but that they cannot be compelled to serve two, three or five terms more than any other persons on account of the greater interest they may have in the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*alleging that it would be a tax imposed upon them in opposition to the colonization law.*/p*
*p*I anticipate the most favorable results from this plan if there is no impediment thrown in the way of its execution; and I pray your *person_mentioned*Lordship */person_mentioned*to communicate to me such doubts as you may feel respecting its realization. If you approve it I wish you would send me a formal approbation, with such corrections and additions as you may deem necessary, that I may publish and circulate it for the information of all concerned.*/p*
*p*God and Liberty.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="08-28-1826">August 28th, 1826*/date_mentioned**/p*.
